# noaide

> Browser-based real-time IDE for AI coding agents (Claude Code, Gemini CLI, Codex). Rust backend + SolidJS frontend + WASM modules.

## Core Documentation (read first)
- [README](README.md): Overview, quick start, architecture, configuration
- [Contributing](CONTRIBUTING.md): Development workflow, commit conventions, code style
- [Testing](TESTING.md): Test strategy, gate matrix, performance benchmarks
- [Security Policy](SECURITY.md): Vulnerability reporting, response timeline

## Architecture Decisions
| ADR | Decision | Rationale |
|-----|----------|-----------|
| ADR-1 | Rust backend (tokio + io_uring) | Zero-copy async I/O, memory safety |
| ADR-2 | SolidJS frontend (fine-grained reactivity) | No virtual DOM, 120fps at 1000+ messages |
| ADR-3 | Zenoh + SHM event bus | ~1us latency, zero-copy shared memory |
| ADR-4 | Limbo DB (io_uring, FTS5, async) | Async SQLite alternative, full-text search |
| ADR-5 | eBPF file watcher | PID attribution, kernel-level efficiency |
| ADR-6 | hecs ECS state engine | Struct-of-arrays, cache-friendly iteration |
| ADR-7 | FlatBuffers (hot) + MessagePack (cold) | Zero-copy hot path, compact cold path |
| ADR-8 | WebTransport-only (QUIC, 0-RTT) | Multiplexed streams, no head-of-line blocking |
| ADR-9 | PTY stdin + tmux send-keys | Session control without shell=true |
| ADR-10 | Catppuccin Mocha theme | Consistent dark theme, accessibility |
| ADR-11 | CodeMirror 6 editor | Modular, tree-sitter integration |
